Description: Fragment from painted pottery vessel. Two confronting goats, grazing: to the right, head, horn, neck and forelegs of one; to the left, head, ear and horn of the other painted as decoration.Very fine mica; black and white inclusions, Munsell 7.5YR 6?3 (light brown), Munsell 10YR 7/3 (very pale brown).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: In NA-Analysis by Professor H. Mommsen (Helmholtz-Institut, Bonn) the fragment is so far a chemical loner.
The Findspot number '18' has been scratched inside.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 57, II. 2) (?)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 230)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p.56 Table 1)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.210)
